text:
In a Perl script, I do a fork(), then handle the resultant PIDs, closing STDIN, 
STDOUT, and STDERR and reopening them to /dev/null (standard technique). 
However, the child process never seems to run under versions 2.0.45 or greater 
of the Apache server. It works fine under 2.0.44 and earlier, as well as under 
all versions of IIS. I don't have access to a Unix platform so I wasn't able to 
test it under that.
creator: mrmosconi@yahoo.com

text:
This is more likely a bug in the perl implementation of fork() than anything,
  and should not be required for most win32 apps.  Win32 doesn't actually fork().

  In any case, sounds like a perl, not httpd, problem, since this isn't running
  within the server but as a seperate perl process.
creator: wrowe@apache.org
